lines.text: Okay, so where's the fire? It's in the oven, I presume.
[He opens the oven to find an artic landscape inside]
Whoops, my mistake. Nothing a little Oozy-off couldn't fix.
[He opens the fridge; flames come out from inside]
Gosh, and I thought French was the romantic language.
Mary had a little lamb... but I ate it!

[reading]
"Of utmost importance in the exorcism of spirits is to keep them amused." Keep them amused, huh? I'll slay 'em. A guy comes up to me on the street, says he hasn't had a bite in weeks. So I bit him.
Howdy, stranger. Just flew in from another world, I see. I bet your arms are tired.
They don't seem all that amused. Must be the culture gap. I'll hit a little closer to home. Did you hear about the girl who didn't pay her exorcism bill? Her soul got repossessed.
Hokay, when did you start having these visions?
